Born a poor young country boy

Paul McCartney (the primary writer of this song) grew up in the country near Liverpool, where he later moved and met John Lennon on July 6th, 1957.  The rest is history.

However, during an interview in 1968, Paul had this to say regarding “Mother Nature’s Son:”

It says ‘“Born a poor young country boy,” and I was born in Woolton hospital actually — so it’s a dirty lie.
